Class AppbaseClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.asynchttpclient.DefaultAsyncHttpClient
      • elasticsearchlibrary.AppbaseClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, org.asynchttpclient.AsyncHttpClient

    public class AppbaseClient
extends org.asynchttpclient.DefaultAsyncHttpClient

    • Constructor Detail

      • AppbaseClient

        public AppbaseClient(java.lang.String URL,
                     java.lang.String app,
                     java.lang.String userName,
                     java.lang.String password)
        Constructor when the elasticsearch setup requires a user name and a password
        Parameters:
        URL - The base URL(example: "http://scalr.api.appbase.io").
        appName - application name (example: "myFirstApp")
        userName - the user name provided for the application
        password - the password corresponding to the userName

      • AppbaseClient

        Parameters:
        URL - The base URL(example: "http://scalr.api.appbase.io").
        appName - application name (example: "myFirstApp")

        public java.lang.String update(java.lang.String type,
                               java.lang.String id,
                               java.util.List<org.asynchttpclient.Param> parameters,
                               java.lang.String jsonDoc)
        To update a document. We can pass just the portion of the object to be updated. parameters is a list of parameters which are the name value pairs which will be added during the execution
        Parameters:

        parameters - A list of all the parameters for a specific update

      • bulkExecute

        public org.asynchttpclient.ListenableFuture<org.asynchttpclient.Response>[] bulkExecute(AppbaseRequestBuilder[] requestBuilders)
        When multiple requests need to be executed but in a sequence to reduce the bandwidth usage.
        Parameters:
        requestBuilders - an array of AppbaseRequestBuilders which need to be executed
        Returns:
        Array of the listenable futures containing the responses of individual requests

      • bulkExecute

        public org.asynchttpclient.ListenableFuture<org.asynchttpclient.Response>[] bulkExecute(java.util.ArrayList<AppbaseRequestBuilder> requestBuilders)
        When multiple requests need to be executed but in a sequence to reduce the bandwidth usage.
        Parameters:
        requestBuilders - an array of AppbaseRequestBuilders which need to be executed
        Returns:
        Array of the listenable futures containing the responses of individual requests
